headline: Gov. DeSantis pledges $30 million to help save Florida manatees
author: Mike Springer
sentences:
My administration will continue working to find new and innovative ways to support our native species, like the manatee so that the generations to come can experience Floridas natural resources.?
Read: Body of missing 21-year-old Sanford man found in burning shed, deputies say
Manatees have been dying in record numbers in what some wildlife leaders are calling an environmental crisis.
In a news conference in Jacksonville, DeSantis announced a commitment of more than $30 million in the 2022-2023 fiscal years budget to help with manatee restoration and rehabilitation efforts.
Click here to download the free WFTV news and weather apps, click here to download the WFTV Now app for your smart TV and click here to stream Channel 9 Eyewitness News live.
This historic funding will support important restoration efforts across the state to benefit our manatees and Floridas natural environment,? DeSantis said.
Temporary response teams at FPLs Cape Canaveral Clean Energy Center have already used more than 200,000 pounds of produce to feed at least 800 manatees.
The governor says there is still a lot of work to be done when it comes to saving the manatees, but he feels this will help supercharge those efforts.
Another $5.3 million would go toward expanding FWCs manatee response efforts and $4.7 million would support research and conservation efforts.
The governors funding would put $20 million toward care facilities, restoring access to springs and habitat restoration.
I know theres been a lot of work thats been done, but this will be able to supercharge those efforts,? DeSantis added.
Ron DeSantis is pledging $30 million in funding toward manatee rescue programs and habitat restoration.
The announcement comes as Florida is on track to see another record year for manatee deaths.
More than 300 deaths have been reported in Brevard County alone this year.
Experts believe a lack of seagrass has led to a high number of deaths.
